700951f-b.title: Bronx: Tremont Avenue (East - Schurz Avenue
700951f-b.text:
(1)
East Tremont Ave., east side, between Schurs Ave. and Silver
Beach Place, showing the Cedar of Lebanon. It stands on the grounds
of the former Huntington estate (prior to that the Havemeyer estate)
and was brougut here and planted in 1790 by Philip Livingston. It
is declared to be the finest specimen of its kind in the United States.
The tree is still standing at this writing (1937).
1906.
Gift of Randall Comfort.
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE ON ALL REPRODUCTIONS.
700951f-b.folder: Tremont Avenue (East & Schurz Avenue, Bronx, NY

701757f-b.title: Bronx: Schurz Avenue - Tremont Avenue (East)
701757f-b.text:
Schurr Avenue, at the N.W. corner of E. Tremont Avenue,
showing a 2~: -story frame house on the former Collis P.
Huntington estate.
View 1: July 15, 1928
View 2: August 15, 1940
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
